rev.comment: give some sort of citation that anti-family planning groups specifically accuse her of racism, and that they are '''often''' attributing false/fabricated quotes
rev.diff:
Line 60: Line 60:
==Legacy==
==Legacy==
â
While anti-family planning groups accuse Margaret Sanger of racism, often attributing false or fabricated quotes to her, she earned the respect of civil rights leaders such as Martin Luther King Jr. and fought for the rights of minorities. In their article about Margaret Sanger, [[Planned Parenthood]] notes:
+
While some groups accuse Margaret Sanger of racism, she earned the respect of civil rights leaders such as [[Martin Luther King Jr.]] and fought for the rights of minorities. In their article about Margaret Sanger, [[Planned Parenthood]] notes:
::"In 1930, Sanger opened a family planning clinic in Harlem that sought to enlist support for contraceptive use and to bring the benefits of family planning to women who were denied access to their city's health and social services. Staffed by a black physician and black social worker, the clinic was endorsed by The Amsterdam News (the powerful local newspaper), the Abyssinian Baptist Church, the Urban League, and the black community's elder statesman, W.E.B. DuBois."
::"In 1930, Sanger opened a family planning clinic in Harlem that sought to enlist support for contraceptive use and to bring the benefits of family planning to women who were denied access to their city's health and social services. Staffed by a black physician and black social worker, the clinic was endorsed by The Amsterdam News (the powerful local newspaper), the Abyssinian Baptist Church, the Urban League, and the black community's elder statesman, W.E.B. DuBois."
